Description: Rim and handle of a tall lagynos. Brick red fabric with sand sized white inclusions and a pale brown to cream slip.
Curator's comments: Parallel from Kom Hadid in Naukratis dated 3rd to 2nd century BC (Leonard 2001, 126, fig.2.39, no.13. see also fabric description). However lagynoi were also produced in the region in the late 2nd to early 1st century BC. 3rd century BC parallels from Hadra, Alexandria (Enklaar 1998, 24, fig.23-4). Enklaar, A. 1998. Preliminary report on the pottery found at Hadra station, in Empereur, J-Y. (ed.), Commerce et Artisant dans l’Alexandrie Hellénistique et Romaine, Paris, 15-24.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IC.110)
